attributes.action: Call for action to save our domiciliary care providers
attributes.additional_details:
The sector is at the edge of collapse with many people having to close their companies
Client will be left forced to cancel care due to increase in costs and contributions, 
we play a crucial part in supporting the NHS to that hospitals are not over crowded with admissions, we reduce falls neglect and mental health by seeing these clients at home , however we are not treated the same as NHS workers.
attributes.background: Care companies can no longer afford to pay the increase in national insurances with the payments we get from councils , we have petrols, travel time, over heads in offices ,pensions all to pay ,which does not cover the cost we get paid for each call with a client,

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.
 
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You may wish to sign this petition which call for NICs increases for social care providers to be reversed: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/700080
and this petition which calls for emergency funding for the adult social care sector: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/700576
